intro: Hormathophylla lapeyrouseana subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lichenwood, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant has a symbiotic relationship with fungi, which is essential for its survival in nutrient-poor soils. Its morphology includes woody stems and small, often clustered inflorescences. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various arthropods.
